intro: Alibertia edulis var. edulis, commonly known as "jatobá-do-cerrado," is a shrub native to the Cerrado biome of Brazil. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically consumed raw or used in traditional dishes. Its leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects. Alibertia edulis var. edulis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species.
